Rule Summary

Edge Endpoint Type Rules

These rules ensure edges connect the correct types of vertices:

  • verification: doc → spec (machine-checkable structural compliance)
  • validation: doc → guidance (human assessment of fitness for purpose)
  • coupling: spec ↔ guidance (1:1 pairing of spec with its guidance)
  • signs: signer → doc (human accountability for validation)
  • qualifies: signer → guidance/module (human qualified to validate)

Vertex Degree Constraints

These rules constrain how many edges of each type can connect to a vertex:

  • doc → verification: 0..1 (at most one verification per document)
  • spec ↔ coupling: exactly 1 (each spec pairs with exactly one guidance)
  • guidance ↔ coupling: exactly 1 (each guidance pairs with exactly one spec)

Face Boundary Type Rules

These rules ensure faces have the correct edge types in their boundary:

  • assurance: must have verification + validation + coupling edges
  • signature: must have validation + qualifies + signs edges
